storyInfo: Viviana, Federico, and Ebenholz enter Kargereich, a pocket dimension that does not exist in reality. Arturia finds that she cannot play her music in Kargereich, and is wounded by the old Lich.

attributes.content: The Ge—the doctor will be here soon.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: *cough*, *cough*...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Are you crying, Viviana?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I don't think I have the strength to wipe away your tears anymore.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You're too kind, too gentle...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I often think back to the day we first met.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I had come from Zwillingstürme to Sturmland just to take you out of Werner's spire. You huddled in the back seat, holding onto your tiny suitcase and leaning gently against my chest.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I was wondering: Was this little girl scared to leave her father? *cough* Scared of life in foreign Kazimierz?
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: But no. You were just trying to stay low, so no one would see your horns and cause trouble for Werner.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Even though it was so late at night, and no one would have paid attention to a car leaving the great spires of the Kurfürst.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You were so little back then...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I don't remember that.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Nein. You do.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You can lament, you can blame, you can mourn, you can regret, you can rage... *cough* All that, and only then can you...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Please... don't leave me...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: You're the only one I have left.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Let me 'see' you... one last time.
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: I'm right here.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: I'm so glad I can't see the expression on your face right now...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: You deserve a better life than this, Viviana... If there really is one...
attributes.name: Cora

attributes.content: Tall as the empress's tower is, it is not endless. Or so she believes.
The spiral staircase extends before her, but direction itself seems to be torn apart by some unknown, irreversible power. She keeps moving forward, but she can't make any progress.
Viviana is tired, and when one is tired, it is easy to notice what one has lost.
Not unlike the twenty-two years of her life.
Are you lost?
Viviana looks up.
She sees a young Caprinae woman, whose face is filled with curiosity and concern.
Sorry, I must have bumped into you in my hurry.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: It's alright.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Are you okay? You look very pale.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: I'm fine... I was just thinking about something.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Do you know this place well?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Ja, I live nearby.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Where does this lead?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Didn't you come here on your own?
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Where it leads is entirely up to where you want to go.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Take care, now. I'll be going.
attributes.name: Gentle Woman

attributes.content: Where I want to go...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana's fingers brush the handrail next to her. Ochre paint covers the emblem of Urtica under a thick layer of dust, so bright it could have been painted yesterday.
The Witch King.
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: She recalls the historical novel Die Glut.
When the Witch King first ascended to the throne, he gave his builders a blueprint of the Genesis Spire, a monument so great, the likes of which Leithanien had never seen.
Simply gazing upon the plans was enough to make one short of breath, as though standing before its foundation.
The Witch King was scrupulous about every last detail of the Genesis Spire, down to the materials and paints used for every fence and railing, which must never fade in color.
It would become the sole symbol of Leithanien.
Has the Genesis Horn fully descended?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: But that woman just now...
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Viviana comes to a startling realization.

The Caprinae who just passed by was like one of the young people living on the outskirts of Zwillingstürme. In the prime of her life, busy and tireless, her voice emanating the warmth of a fresh cup of tea.
She should not be here. Neither at the empress' spire, nor in the Genesis Horn.
Viviana turns around. No one is there.
What about you, Viviana?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why are you here?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.content: Why did you come back to Leithanien? Why did you leave?
attributes.name: Viviana

attributes.text: You couldn't say goodbye to your father. You couldn't return to the spire of your childhood, that tower you memorized along with the rain and wet moss.
You watched Cora die in your arms. You couldn't take her away from this dusk-scorched city.
What can you stop? What can you change? What can you possibly accomplish?
If the Witch King isn't dead, if he sits at the end of this endless spiral, would you beg him for enlightenment, just like those fanatics?
It really does sound a bit absurd.

attributes.content: The staircase stretches on and on... until Viviana sees a door in an inconspicuous corner.
A tiny, familiar door.
Attempting to turn left at each intersection, to ensure progress through continuous deviation.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Unsuccessful.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Attempting to descend.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Failed to reach bottom of staircase after forty-five minutes. Attempt unsuccessful.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico has spent a long time on the staircase of the empress's spire. He stops in his tracks after yet another failed attempt.
At the most basic level, Arts are a rigid form of order.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: The Twin Empresses would not have hired a mentally ill architect to design their Spires, and no artificer could have recreated such orderless architecture.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: My judgment was impaired due to my experience at Ludwigs-Universität's Sonata Spire... The distortion occurring within this tower is unrelated to Arts.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Has the Genesis Horn covered the entire spire, causing changes in reality?
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Arturia's music is also absent...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: After a brief pause, Federico pulls out his shotgun and fires in front of him.
The sound of the gunshot fills the space, but the projectiles vanish right before his eyes, as though wiped away by some formless something.
Herr Sankta!

As he hears the sound, Federico sees the projectiles again, now moving with a slow and clear trajectory, like a rock skipping across the water. Ripples spread, and everything beneath the surface is revealed.
Phew—
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Put away your gun, please!
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: This is...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Put away your gun, please!
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: I do not require you to repeat yourself.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: I've heard something similar from everyone I met on this mission.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Of course you did. This is Zwillingstürme, not Laterano.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Loris always liked to talk about Laterano. He said that when the Sankta go out, they 'bang' any buildings they don't like, and 'bang' the buildings they do like even more eagerly.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Jan and I used to think he was making things up because he didn't like his hometown very much.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Anyway, look around you.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Zwillingstürme is an old city. Any brick or tile could have a score or a poem etched on it by a drunk artist from a century ago.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: This is...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Federico quickly assesses the sight before him.
If this place is the Genesis Horn, where the Witch King's legacy is kept, Arturia's final destination...
Then it is difficult to believe that his bullets could have broken through some sort of barrier and brought him here from that strange staircase.
Federico examines the woman before him. The anger on her face is no more and no less than that of a citizen performing her civic duty to stop a rude tourist.
Do you understand me, Herr Sankta? Put away your gun... please.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: Excuse me.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: We are clearly not on the streets of Zwillingstürme, but you seem unaware of this.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: You have mentioned a Loris and a Jan. Assuming you are referring to Loris Bordin and Jan Schüler...
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Please, tell me your name.
attributes.name: Federico

attributes.content: Yulia... Yulia Schüler.
attributes.name: Anxious Woman

attributes.content: This is inside the Genesis Horn? The Witch King's resting place?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: But the Witch King...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Stop looking around, little angel.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: You caught up... I'm not surprised.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I wish I could say the same. The last thing I expected was for you to actually cling to a Lich's thread and be voluntarily Exiled.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: So where is the Witch King?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Dead. What else?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: No, I should be able to sense him. His Arts, his emotions, his will... if I just...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arturia looks around. It is a space without boundaries, defined by only indescribable flows of light like the respiration of the void.
She steadies her cello, puts her hand on the strings, and sets her bow.
Silence.
Bow touches string, but the vibration produces no sound. The motion familiar to her, so natural, has lost all meaning here.
Finally noticed?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: I can't play.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I've... lost my music.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Is it because of the Genesis Horn? Or the 'rules' of the Witch King?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Arrogant. Foolish. Witless. That petty halo over your head is shedding light on your pale face. I wish it could do the same to your brain.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Where do you think you are right now?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Inside Herkunftshorn's coffin? A treasure trove of the Pashas of Sargon? A witch's magic pocket from a Victorian fairy tale?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Herr Fremont...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Sarkaz) 'The beginning and end of all threads.'
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: As though muttering to himself, Fremont speaks an unfamiliar word in Sarkaz.
Or maybe the name he gave it would be more in line with your understanding.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: (Leithanian) Desolate Domain.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Kargereich?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: What you're seeing is the other side of the 'real,' a dimension always in flux. Any rule, any reality disintegrates before it in an instant.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Through the long eons, the Liches have caught only glimpses of it, and despite Herkunftshorn's life's work, the best he could manage was to create a tiny, volatile bubble in this infinite void.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Arturia does not respond to Fremont's anger. She simply touches the strings again. The unbroken hush.
There is no disappointment or fear, only confusion.
An emotion that only flashes across Arturia's face before she looks up and smiles.
Perfect.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: So the Witch King didn't prolong his will through mystical arts, but instead created his own retreat in Kargereich.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: This pocket still exists, so he must be here... It's just that there's still a ways to go to reach his throne.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...Aren't you curious what happens if you're Exiled again in Kargereich?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Arturia realizes that the shadows are growing.
The Lich's witchcraft had been moving while she was speaking. Thread-like shadows grow into thick vines around Fremont, merging into the ambiguous colors of the ground, and begin to come at her.
Death and extinction. Decay in its full bloom.
...I still haven't found my answer.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I have to rediscover my music. I must perform the Witch King.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I can't...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: ...die yet.
She is perfectly willing to meet her end performing. But what she can't accept is to fade into silence, with the truth so near.
The shadows crack, and a gray rain rushes up to engulf all.
Der Wiener Uhrturm rings!
attributes.name: The Witch King's Musician

attributes.content: Go, to the Genesis Spire! The performance begins—
attributes.name: The Witch King's Musician

attributes.content: New music, new Arts... protecting Vedunien against Catastrophe and the cannons of Gaul...
attributes.name: The Witch King's Musician

attributes.content: Herk... Herkunftshorn...
attributes.name: The Witch King's Musician

attributes.content: Reality is unstable here.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Was it caused by the Exile?
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: No, it was like this before we entered Kargereich. Herkunftshorn's power is diminishing.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: ...The Genesis Horn's collapse is accelerating.
attributes.name: Fremont

attributes.content: Argh—!
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: I'm... still alive?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: The melody... it's gone...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: She clung to the one string of sound distinct from the environment, and escaped the threads of Exile.
Now, the melody has become tangible, emerging from the void and descending before her.
It has taken human form.
(Unintelligible sounds)
You're...
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Was it your melody that saved my life?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: (Unintelligible sounds)
Were you... a spire caster of the Witch King?
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Th-The Witch King?!
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: How could you think that?!
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: ...I'm sorry.
attributes.name: Arturia

attributes.content: Careful, keep your voice down.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Is someone after you?
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: You're hurt... stay put and hide here.
attributes.name: Yulia

attributes.content: Don't worry, I know this place well. No one will find it.
attributes.name: Yulia
